sanskrit_verse:
अग्नेः सोमयमाभ्यां च कृत्वाऽप्यायनमादितः ।
हविर्दानेन विधिवत्पश्चात्संतर्पयेत्पितॄन् ॥ ३.२११॥
transliteration:
agneḥ somayamābhyāṃ ca kṛtvā'pyāyanam āditaḥ |
havirdānena vidhivat paścāt saṃtarpayet pitṝn || 3.211||
sph_interpretive_translation: Having first offered oblations to Agni, Soma, and Yama, and having performed the ritual feeding properly, one shall afterward satisfy the ancestors through offerings.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority flows from proper sequential worship and invocation
Causation is established by order of ritual precedence
Capacity-based responsibility requires alignment with cosmic order before familial duty
Restoration logic begins with divine satisfaction prior to ancestral fulfillment
Consciousness alignment necessitates adherence to Vedic procedural hierarchy

supreme_court_application: In matters concerning intergenerational dharma or estate duties, the court must recognize that obligations toward higher authorities take precedence. Legal validity of familial acts depends on prior fulfillment of cosmic obligations. The threshold of responsibility lies in establishing correct ontological sequence.

Anupūrvaśaḥ ensures proportional responsibility without blame; omission results in natural incompleteness rather than punitive consequence. Reality enforces its own logic through causal integrity.

Integrate individual act within universal dharmic framework
